website_summaries.verdict: The scalable PlantLink system isn't foolproof or comprehensive, but it does a fine job of using the Internet to communicate your plant's watering needs.
pros: Oso Technology's PlantLink tracks moisture accurately and uses that information with charming smart features to help you keep track of when your plants need water
cons: Since it only measures moisture, PlantLink is comparatively limited in what it can do
Recommendations won't tell you how much water to give your plant

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable sensors.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered three of these because the individual sensors were not available at any store, or online, or on the Planlink website. I was very stupid. All of the sensors have failed. The probes which go into the ground look like they are just copper-clad circuit boards. All of the ones I have corroded very quickly. All three show very different readings (from 12 % to 40%) even when set right next to each other or in a contained bucket of soil. The website and receiver units seem fine, but the most important parts are the sensors. Very disappointed! The web site has been promising a new product called Lush.... forever. The old units are all sold out. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: M. Papa

customer_reviews.title: So far im happy with it except one thing i cant find any ...
customer_reviews.text: So far im happy with it except one thing i cant find any extra links anywere to put in more plants.
customer_reviews.author: justin

customer_reviews.title: I couldent get it to connect to the internet. ...
customer_reviews.text: I couldent get it to connect to the internet. After searching online for help found out PlantLink has discontinued this model. I returned it. They tell me there may be a new model coming out in the future.
customer_reviews.author: LACustomer

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I hooked it up to SmartThings. I am a single male in a 1BR apartment. I am typically pretty bad at remembering household tasks. My plant on my balcony would be dead without this!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Rea

customer_reviews.title: Working Great
customer_reviews.text: Have had my system for several weeks now and it is working well. I'm using a link in each of 3 planters growing herbs and peppers and monitoring them independently. I had previously used a homemade system driven by an arduino, but have found the PlantLink to be much more stable.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Meadows

customer_reviews.title: So far so good..
customer_reviews.text: So far so good... I bought 3 of the sensors and the one that came with the hub had dead batteries. Sucks that the sensors are so expensive. I feel a little silly putting a $35 sensor in a pot with a plant I spent $5 on... but this is more of a "fun" thing than anything. Update - the 3rd sensor worked after replacing the batteries. However, the pairing process is very poor, so I'm leaving it as 3 stars. 1 of my 3 paired quickly (10 mins), another took an hour, the 3rd (one with the replaced batteries) took about 3 hours. I'll still buy more though because I think this is pretty 'neat'.
customer_reviews.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed that there is not phone app
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed that there is not phone app. You have to log in to the web page to see the readings.
customer_reviews.author: KHJ

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Effective
customer_reviews.text: I'm finally not going to drown or starve my palm. Extremely easy to setup. I only used one of the sensors, but it seems easy to expand.
customer_reviews.author: Jaymes Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Terribly flimsy probes
customer_reviews.text: Works OK but extremely flimsy and brittle probes. They are basically just an extension of the main board from inside the case. Broke mine after a few weeks of use.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Tochilovsky

customer_reviews.title: Previously registered
customer_reviews.text: Product is still registered on an account cannot install please unregister
customer_reviews.author: filmbuff?

customer_reviews.title: Overall it was a good product.
customer_reviews.text: Link stopped working in about a month. Overall it was a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Sales

customer_reviews.title: No Android Support
customer_reviews.text: Wow... I have a friend that raved over this and how he was able to select the type of plant and it adjusted the watering for that plant... I bought the base station and multiple probes only to find out it will not work for me since it doesn't support Android. Wow... it's 2016 and a company can release a product that doesn't support both IOS and Android? So if you are an Apple IOS User you will probably like this product... But if you are like most of the world and use Android you are S O L and will not be able to take advantage of most of the features.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Patterson

customer_reviews.title: good idea in theory but the unit never actually connected ...
customer_reviews.text: good idea in theory but the unit never actually connected to the base station and ended up in the trash
customer_reviews.author: GroovyD

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected
customer_reviews.text: Not really ready for prime time ... wish it did more than water.
customer_reviews.author: R C P

customer_reviews.title: Takes the guesswork out of maintaining healthy houseplants!
customer_reviews.text: Until I started using Plantlink, I was constantly guessing about when and how much to water my houseplants. I either watered them too much or too little, always resulting in ultimately killing the plant. I love having plants in my house for their calming effects and air purification and now, with the help of Plantlink I am able to keep all of my plants healthy and do not have to constantly replace them! :) Also, I love the app that goes with the product - makes it so easy and convenient to see which plant needs water at what time! Thank you Plantlink!!!!! :o) Saving me tons of time and money from replacing plants!
customer_reviews.author: MemOhKat

customer_reviews.title: Corrosion Warning
customer_reviews.text: We bought four separate units including the base stations as the sensors were not available stand alone. All four sensors have now corroded fully and took the batteries out with them. I can not, and will never recommend this product. It worked great for around a week, then it all went down hill.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Viva la PlantLink
customer_reviews.text: Got this from a friend who was in the company in exchange for a review. Plantlink company was gutted, and now customer service is now non existent. The range is terrible. It simply doesn't work as advertised. I'm changing my review so I don't feel guilty about anyone spending money on this based on my original review.
customer_reviews.author: trentshrimp

customer_reviews.title: Discontinued but worked good back in the day
customer_reviews.text: This product was good until it was discontinued and service to it stop when acquired by Scott’s due to a cloud problem early 2018. Setup was kind of difficult at first. Had additional trouble connecting to Samsung Smartthings. It measured the moisture and allowed me to keep my plants / soil healthy. The app was easy to use. THIS PRODUCT IS NO LONGER BEEN SERVICED.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Alvarado

customer_reviews.title: My ground orchids are thriving!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried for years to grow them. The only thing that made a difference was PlantLink. It is very easy to set up and to add more links. I have four already and would love a few more. The range is solid and the quality of information has helped me yield great results from my lemon tree. Thanks to this system, the following has happened: I have watermelons and lettuce growing in the yard! I have a very happy tropical almond tree, The tiny avocado tree I am monitoring is doing well. Batteries last less than predicted, but it isn't a big deal. I love using this system!
customer_reviews.author: Carolina

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to setup and has about a 50ft range (through ...
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to setup and has about a 50ft range (through several walls). I've only had it running for a few hours and it's already reporting levels. I hope to get it dialed in a little better for my SIP but it's interesting to see.
customer_reviews.author: M. Millspaugh

customer_reviews.title: I've used it indoors to winter over plants I'd hoped to use outside the following year and had great success. Now that summer's
customer_reviews.text: I bought my PlantLink a few months ago and it has been a trouble free boon to my garden. I've used it indoors to winter over plants I'd hoped to use outside the following year and had great success. Now that summer's here, one of the links remains inside while the others are outside to make sure my monstrous tropical plants and annual flowers in beds are doing well, too. Love the email reminders that my plants send me when they need water; the accompanying website is easy to use and update. Plan to buy more!
customer_reviews.author: dtb1985

customer_reviews.title: Easy, worry free
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup, huge inventory of plants, long transmission range, easy to add more sensors, I guess only available on their website though, myplantlink.com. I can keep track of pretty much all of my plants from anywhere. Once I setup the system I don’t worry...it tells me when the plants need water.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Born

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I'm not much of a gardener, but when I received this as a gift it encouraged me to test out my thumb. And with Plantlink's help, turns out it's a little green! I've started growing my own herb garden and so far have kept every plant alive. Fine, there are just 3 of them, but that's a start. I also bought one for a friend, and he loves it too.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Solomon

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: I am not a gadget guy, but I had to have this thing. I have a third generation Hoya plant that means a lot to me. It likes to be dry between waterings. but not starved for any length of time. Overwatering can kill it. PlanfLink as the perfect tool for water management. I was shocked to find that it took twice as long for the soil to dry as I had thought.
customer_reviews.author: rick McCanse

customer_reviews.title: Keeps its promises.
customer_reviews.text: I received this as a gift for my indoor garden (flowers and herbs), along with some extra Links. It actually makes me want to get more plants. Zero hassle. I look like a "green thumb" haha..
customer_reviews.author: Julia Larkin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this product. It's works great. I use it to monitor my plants in my yard. Very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Garrick

customer_reviews.title: very poor cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Sensor died in less than a month, very poor cheaply made. It's a lot of money for garbage!!
customer_reviews.author: Leo Cyr

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: "I love this product. Easy to install and I get reminded when I need to water my aloe."
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: PlantLink Wireless Plant Sensor Indoors Outdoors. Monitors Soil Humidity and Sends Alerts When Plants Need Water
product_meta.description: PlantLink makes watering simple and efficient. By combining moisture sensors with the PlantLink app, PlantLink lets you know when your plants need water. Simply place Links in soil indoors or outdoors, and the system will calibrate to the plant’s watering needs using our catalog of over 50,000 plants. Never worry about over or under-watering again.
feature_bullets: REMOTE MONITORING FROM ANYWHERE WITH FREE iOS APP
MONITOR UP TO 64 PLANTS WITH A SINGLE BASE STATION-UP TO 100yrd RANGE. Use this ASN B00U1QX19U, to order more sensors.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 2.5 out of 5 stars42 ratings2.5 out of 5 stars
